name: Lion
fact: The lion is called the king of the jungle and lives in grasslands and savannas.

name: Tiger
fact: Tigers have stripes that help them hide in forests.

name: Elephant
fact: Elephants are the largest land animals and use their trunks to eat and drink.

name: Bear
fact: Bears eat plants, insects, and sometimes fish.

name: Giraffe
fact: Giraffes have very long necks to reach high leaves.

name: Zebra
fact: Zebras have unique black and white stripes.

name: Monkey
fact: Monkeys are playful and use their hands and tails to climb.

name: Dog
fact: Dogs are friendly animals that live with people.

name: Cat
fact: Cats are curious pets that purr when happy.

name: Cow
fact: Cows give us milk and live on farms.

name: Horse
fact: Horses are strong animals that people ride.

name: Goat
fact: Goats can climb steep hills and give milk.

name: Sheep
fact: Sheep grow wool that we can use for clothes.

name: Kangaroo
fact: Kangaroos carry babies in a pouch and hop.

name: Panda
fact: Pandas mostly eat bamboo and live in China.

name: Camel
fact: Camels store fat in their humps and live in deserts.

name: Rabbit
fact: Rabbits have long ears and like to eat carrots and greens.

name: Deer
fact: Deer are shy animals that live in forests and fields.

name: Fox
fact: Foxes are clever hunters that move quietly.

name: Wolf
fact: Wolves live and hunt in packs.

name: Parrot
fact: Parrots are colorful birds that can mimic sounds and words.

name: Owl
fact: Owls can see well at night and say hoo hoo.

name: Peacock
fact: Peacocks spread big colorful tails to show off.

name: Sparrow
fact: Sparrows are small birds that live near people.

name: Crow
fact: Crows are smart black birds.

name: Duck
fact: Ducks float on water and say quack.

name: Eagle
fact: Eagles are large birds that fly high and hunt.

name: Penguin
fact: Penguins are birds that cannot fly but swim well.

name: Flamingo
fact: Flamingos stand on one leg and are pink.

name: Woodpecker
fact: Woodpeckers peck trees to find insects.

name: Pigeon
fact: Pigeons are common city birds that coo.

name: Swan
fact: Swans glide on water with long necks.

name: Kingfisher
fact: Kingfishers dive into water to catch fish.

name: Hen
fact: Hens live on farms and lay eggs.

name: Rooster
fact: Roosters say cock-a-doodle-doo in the morning.

name: Snake
fact: Snakes have no legs and move by slithering.

name: Crocodile
fact: Crocodiles live in rivers and have strong jaws.

name: Turtle
fact: Turtles have hard shells for protection.

name: Lizard
fact: Lizards can climb and some can drop their tails.

name: Chameleon
fact: Chameleons change color to blend in.

name: Iguana
fact: Iguanas are large lizards that like warm places.

name: Alligator
fact: Alligators look like crocodiles but have wider snouts.

name: Gecko
fact: Geckos can stick to walls and ceilings.

name: Python
fact: Pythons are big snakes that squeeze.

name: Tortoise
fact: Tortoises live mostly on land and move slowly.

name: Frog
fact: Frogs jump and live near water.

name: Toad
fact: Toads have bumpy skin and live on land.

name: Salamander
fact: Salamanders have long bodies and live in wet places.

name: Dolphin
fact: Dolphins are smart swimmers that leap from the ocean.

name: Fish
fact: Fish live in water and breathe with gills.

name: Whale
fact: Whales are giant animals that live in the ocean.

name: Shark
fact: Sharks are strong fish with sharp teeth.

name: Octopus
fact: Octopuses have eight arms and can squirt ink.
